item.title: Guest report on the Bristol traffic blog
item.description: Last month I posted a note here recommending the Bristol Traffic blog. I’m now proud to have supplied a guest entry on that blog, poking fun at poor parking on Picton Street.
item.author: tag@wordaligned.org (Thomas Guest)

item.title: Bristol traffic blog
item.description:
I hesitate to recommend another blog — just two weeks after I promoted Dave Moulton’s Bike Blog the author seems to be packing it in — but if you need to get from A to B in Bristol, subscribe to the Bristol Traffic blog:

In which we explore the options for getting round Bristol, and the consequences of those decisions.

Actually, it’s just a collection of pictures of people parking badly, and a sarcastic commentary. What’s not to like?
item.author: tag@wordaligned.org (Thomas Guest)

item.title: Dave Moulton’s bike blog
item.description:
If you like bicycles, I recommend Dave Moulton’s bike blog. Last month he relocated from Blogger to Squarespace, and I’ve only just caught up with the new site and adjusted my feed-reader accordingly, the reason being that, when he announced the move, the new site was down (Oops!) so I couldn’t take immediate action.

Dave Moulton’s Bike Blog feed: http://davesbikeblog.squarespace.com/blog/atom.xml.

Incidentally, I use Feedburner, which means I should be able to relocate my site or use different publishing software, and maintain a persistent feed location.
item.author: tag@wordaligned.org (Thomas Guest)
